header.title: What is Nitrogen Dioxide NO₂?
header.description: Nitrogen Dioxide (NO₂), accounts for more than 70% of the air present in the environment. And it is the most abundant gas present. For instance, Traffic on the road and the burning of fossil fuels result in poisonous NO₂ air pollution. Hence, it is harmful to humans, plants, and animals.

sources.title: Sources Of Nitrogen Dioxide (NO2) Gas
sources.description: NO₂ is present in the environment in a very small quantity. But due to our excessive use of resources and other activities, nitrogen dioxide level is increasing to a troublesome level. There are both natural and men-made causes of the formation of the no2 gas.

volcanic.description: Volcano eruption or active volcanic sites.
volcanic.alt: Volcano eruption or active volcanic sites

fertilizer.description: Biological decay of waste for fertilizer

lightning.description: Lightning strikes- facilitates the formation of the NO₂ gas.

manmade.title: Manmade means of production of Nitrogen Dioxide (NO2) gas are:

vehicles.description: Car, truck, boots, and airplane emissions

stoves.alt: no2 from Kerosene and gas stoves

sources.mainSource: The main source of nitrogen dioxide produced by human activity is the combustion of fossil fuels. Such as the fuel used in automobiles, the creation of nitric acid, welding, explosives, refinement of petrol and metals, and commercial and food processing.

impacts.title: Health & Environmental Impacts of NO₂ Gas
impacts.description: NO₂ is part of the NOx group of highly reactive gases. Whereas NO₂ is a brownish acidic gas with and pungent odor. It reacts with O2 to form nitric acid responsible for corrosion. And it also plays role in the formation of other pollutants like smog, PM, and acid rain. It is a flame accelerator but itself not combustible.

health.title: Health Impacts Due to Nitrogen Dioxide (NO2)

premature.title: Reduced birth weight, high risk of premature death

environmental.title: Environmental effects are severe due to excessive concentration of this gas:

pm.title: Increases PM levels
pm.alt: Increases PM levels due to no2

acidRain.title: Acid rain- forming an acidic compound with moisture present in the air

vegetation.title: Affects the vegetation, growth of plants

noxPm.title: NOx + other chemicals leads to formation of PM.

plantStress.title: Acts as a stressor to plants and results in chlorophyll content reduction.
plantStress.alt: stressor to plants due to no2

measures.title: Corrective Measures To Reduce Nitrogen Dioxide (NO2) Gas
measures.description: The primary preventive measure is to monitor the concentration of NO₂ which our Prana air sensor and Air quality monitors are quite useful. Other than that there are some corrective measures that could help us keep safe from the respiratory repercussion of this gas:

steps.lowEmission: Vehicles with low emission rates can help us with the reduced production of NO₂
steps.alternateFuels: Alternate fuels including hydrogen cells and electric-powered cars can be useful in bringing down the overall footprint of NO₂ production.
steps.avoidCongestion: Avoid traffic congestion. Improving engines to be more efficient
steps.closedEnvironment: Use of a closed environment for the production of fertilizer and processing of the gases produced in it.
